author:
John Reid

Daily News Staff Writer
title: Q&A with Stanford's Bret Bonanni
text:
Q&A with Stanford's Bret Bonanni By John Reid Posted: 10/21/2015 01:55:50 PM PDT Updated: 10/22/2015 07:09:50 AM PDT Senior attacker Bret Bonanni is doing his part for the Stanford men's water polo team. Bonanni has a team-leading 58 goals this season for the No. 5 Cardinal, 14-6 overall, 0-3 in the Mountain Pacific Sports Federation. Bonanni is eight goals shy of tying Tony Azevedo's Stanford and MPSF scoring record of 332 goals, set in 2001-04. Stanford hosts UC Santa Barbara on Saturday at 4 p.m. Bonanni spoke to Daily News reporter John Reid on Tuesday. 
DN: Do you think about being close to becoming Stanford's all-time leading scorer? 
BB: I try not to think about it. I'm putting whatever I need to do to help the team first. The record doesn't matter much to me. 
DN: How is the team doing this year? 
BB: We're constantly striving to get better. We won't be satisfied until we are holding up that championship banner. We have a ways to go. 
DN: Do you have a chance to win the national title? 
BB: We aren't out of it, yet. We need to rally to come together. It depends on the way we perform. 
DN: What happened in last year's NCAA's? 
BB: We lost in the semifinals to USC in double-overtime. It was hard. 
DN: You went to high school at Mater Dei in Los Angeles. Isn't that a basketball school? 
BB: They were really good in basketball, but we were good in water polo, too. We won CIF all four years I was there. 
DN: Do you think about this year being your last year at Stanford? Advertisement 
BB: It pops into my head a lot. Thinking about it doesn't help anything. If anything, I use it as motivation to fire me up. I'll think about it when it is over. 
DN: What do you plan to do when you leave Stanford? 
BB: I immediately go play with the U.S. National Team. I'll eventually play water polo overseas. 
DN: Have you made the U.S. Olympic Team for the 2016 Olympics? 
BB: We're all fighting for a spot. We should know in a few months and that will make it less stressful. I have to stay on top of my game. 
Email John Reid at jreid@dailynewsgroup.com ; follow him at twitter.com/dailynewsjohn .
